artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Maruya Jinpachi; Carver: Katada Chōjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 199; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 301.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two separate sheets, placed vertically; squatting frowning man wearing white, black and pale blue armor, with a yellow robe underneath and a white sash around his waist; man holds a spear in his PR hand; white banner with black text behind man; dark blue background
dimension: 27 1/4 × 9 3/8 in. (69.22 × 23.81 cm) (overall, approx., Vertical ōban, upright diptych)
markings: Carver’s seal: 彫工長治朗 {Horikō Chōjirō} | Censor seal: 卯八改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: 応需魁斎芳年画 {ōju Kaisai Yoshitoshi}
text: Related to the play Kachidoki kachidoki shichiji no hatairo 魁音仝七字旗色, performed at the Nakamura Theater in the 8th month of 1867.
title: Actor Nakamura Shikan IV as Katō Kiyomasa
